Title: 14.1 Built-In Function and Operator Reference
14.15 Information Functions
Description:
SYSTEM_USER() is a synonym for
          USER().

Note


            The SYSTEM_USER() function is
            distinct from the SYSTEM_USER
            privilege. The former returns the current MySQL account
            name. The latter distinguishes the system user and regular
            user account categories (see
            Section 8.2.11, “Account Categories”).

Like USER(), this function can
          be used for the default value of a
          VARCHAR or
          TEXT column, as shown in the
          following CREATE TABLE
          statement:
Press CTRL+C to copy CREATE TABLE t (c VARCHAR(288) DEFAULT (SYSTEM_USER()));
